result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Kyle Dean Hines was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

IID TO COMMENCE WHEN THE DEF OBTAINS ANY TYPE OF VALID DL, OR WHEN THE DEF CHOOSES TO DRIVE W/O A VALID DL; SUBJECT TO FURTHER PENALTY  
IID for a period of 2 YEARS to any vehicle owned, operated or registered to the def.

records.addlTxt: Defendant Kyle Dean Hines in court, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Judge recalls case - he does not have the authority to sentence on the EC Co Case 11CF753 is vacated and the 10CF4 Pepin Co is vacated.  Judge states his sentence on Pierce Co Case 14CF144  stands and it is concurrent to the sentence that DOC gives him on the ES cases 10CF4 and 11CF753

2:29  Defendant Kyle Dean Hines in court, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Recomenadtion of DOC  4CF144 Confinement  of 1 yr 6 months and 2 years ES Defendant states he does not wish to have an attorney. Judge reviews the defendants right to an attorney with him. Judge states that he was the drug court judge when the defendant was in Drug Court. The defendant and DA OSullivan do not want a different judge. OSullivan  1 1/2rs confinement  2 yrs ES   In the other 2 cases 1yr and 9 months,  Court orders  14CF144  Court believes the defendant has some mental health issues and would like that looked at in prison. 1/1/2 years confinement 2 years ES.  Credit for 389 days   Not eligible for CIP or Substance Abuse Program..    Enter $4084.80  civil judgment on 14CF144.    10CF 4  1yr 9 mo.confinement concurrent to  sentence in 14CF144  11CF753  1 yr 9 M0 Confinment  concurrent to   10CF4 and  14CF144.  357 days Credit on 10CF4 and 11CF753
filed by Sadie Zolnik

Called at 9:30 a.m.  Dan Chapman present w/Kyle re: termination hearing from DC.  DA Sean Froelich present w/DC Team.  Court notes motion to terminate, written notice given to Kyle re: violations and rights.  Notes meeting w/DC team before hearing.  Atty. Chapman does not wish to put anything further on the record but states Kyle wishes to remain in program.  Adjourned for team to meet.  Recall at 10:03 a.m. Mary K. advised that team has met and discussed recommendation.  Team voted to not terminate Kyle at this point.  Requests he be held in PC Jail until therapist can meet with him and come up with appropriate treatment options.  No objections from Atty. Chapman.  Motion to Terminate withdrawn.  Court Orders for Kyle Hines to retained in Pierce County Jail to meet with therapist.  He is to remain in custody until at least next Tuesday, until further Court Order.
Notice of Hearing.
FAX from Kyle - sent JOC to PCJ and forwarded wage assignment request to his PO.  Fine is DOC collects.
to Judge from Greg Amann with response from Judge Bole
from Def to Judge Boles - (response is to file dated 12-19-2014)

3:07  14CT79 is also included in this hearing. Defendant Kyle Dean Hines in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  Defendant Kyle Dean Hines in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plead to ?Ct 1 in 14CF144. Dism Ct 2 and 14CT79   OSullivan's   recomedation Sentence imposed 3 yrs conf  3 yrs ES.  and stay 2 1/2 years.    Amann argues the sentence  S/W Probation 3 yrs. Court exams the defendant regarding his understanding of the sentence recomendations.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def  Constitutional rights explained to defendant  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights  DEF PLEADS GUILTY to Ct 1 14CF144.  Facts are correct  COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS  The court finds the defendant guilty of Ct 1 in amended info.  Ct 2 is dismissed. 14CT79 is dismissed. 
 Court orders: S/W Probation 3 years   Conditions: Successfully Complete the Pierce County Drug Court Program.  6 Months conditional jail time credit for time served.  Any treatment programs the agent deems necessary. Court Costs and DNA Surcharge of $250.00

10:13 am
Defendant Kyle Dean Hines in court with attorney T Gregory Amann.  Kyle Dean Hines is in custody.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Ellsworth PD Officer Corey Van Effen sworn and examined by Froelich.  PBT .19  Witness IDs defendant.  Record so reflects.  Amann x-exams.  Froelich has one exhibit to file.  Does not indicate what that exhibit is.  Exh #1.  Froelich makes argument.  Amann makes argument.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.   Froelich asks that bond remain the same.  Amann asks for signature bond or reasonable cash bond.  Froelich $5000 signature bond and absolute sobriety.  Amann is asking for $250 cash  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 30, 2014 at 03:45 pm.
and Motion for Discovery and Inspection filed by Greg Amann

Requests extension of time limits for good cause.  Atty. Amann has no objection, Court grants.  PH rescheduled, DA's office will arrange for transport. Atty. Amann requests cash bond on both cases, Court will address bond modification at next hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
